channel.title: Why cant i open .class files
channel.description:
for some reason i click on on like client.class and it says that it has to know what program made it to open it and that it can use internet to find yadda yadda yadaa.
if you know how to fix please tell

item.title: Why cant i open .class files
item.dc:creator: @MasterofPK MasterofPK
item.description:
@MasterofPK wrote:

To edit a server, you have to find the .Java files.

So open Client.Java

Find some stuff to edit.

Save

Close it

Double client on Compile.bat or Compiler.bat

It will say some crap about java and stuff.

Then open run.bat and your away!

(oh and if run.bat says “server already in use” Close the run.bat down the bottom :rolleyes:)

Read full topic

soo how i edit server then

Read full topic

item.title: Why cant i open .class files
item.dc:creator: @MasterofPK MasterofPK
item.description:
@MasterofPK wrote:

Basically .class files are what the computer reads, because it cant read .java files.

When you edit a .java file and compile, the compiler adds the information you added into the .java file into the .class file.

So that next time you do run.bat the computer runs the server on the information in the .class file.

Sort of hard to understand but you will get there.

Hope it helped.

Read full topic

item.description:
@snakefang wrote:

Use the file client.java edit what you want, then compile and it will become a class and you edited it, woohoo =P
